overview: From 2026-01-25 to 2026-02-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: broker auth mode with offline tests
topPRs.author: vbkotecha
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Add broker auth mode and OAuth2 PKCE flow with clear error handling and config validation. - Add mock broker/Twitter API and offline unit/e2e tests with 100% coverage gating. - Update docs, agent config, and cursor rules to prioritize enterprise/broker setup. ## Test plan - [x] `bun run test:coverage` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added broker-based authentication mode with broker URL and API key support. * Added a local mock broker server and a runnable mock:broker script for development. * **Documentation** * Updated Quick Start, testing guides, and troubleshooting to include broker mode and mock broker workflows. * Clarified broker-specific configuration examples and behavior notes. * **Tests** * Expanded E2E and unit tests to cover broker flows and mocked Twitter API scenarios. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR implements a fully functional broker authentication mode for Twitter, replacing the previous stub implementation. The broker mode allows agents to obtain short-lived OAuth2 access tokens from a centralized broker service by calling `GET {TWITTER_BROKER_URL}/v1/twitter/access-token` with `Authorization: Bearer {TWITTER_BROKER_API_KEY}`. **Key Changes:** - Implemented complete `BrokerAuthProvider` with comprehensive error handling, URL validation, and response validation - Added `TWITTER_BROKER_API_KEY` to environment schema and configuration validation - Updated documentation to prioritize enterprise/broker setup over developer account setup - Added 100% coverage threshold and comprehensive offline test suite (unit + E2E) using mock broker and Twitter API servers - Included mock broker script for local development and testing - Added `.cursorrules` to document project standards for testing, error messaging, and broker implementation **Testing:** All tests run offline with mocked services. The PR includes unit tests for all error paths and E2E tests with real HTTP servers to validate the full broker authentication flow. **Note:** The `expires_at` field from the broker response is validated but not currently used for token caching or refresh logic. Consider storing this for future optimization.

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - Score reflects thorough implementation with comprehensive test coverage (100% threshold), clear error handling, backward compatibility, excellent documentation updates, and adherence to offline testing principles. The broker implementation is well-isolated and follows the existing auth provider pattern. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | src/client/auth-providers/broker.ts | Implemented broker auth provider with comprehensive error handling and config validation. `expires_at` validated but unused. | | src/environment.ts | Added `TWITTER_BROKER_API_KEY` to schema and validation with clear error messages for missing credentials. | | src/index.ts | Updated plugin initialization to check both broker URL and API key with improved logging messages. | | vitest.config.ts | Added 100% coverage threshold for auth providers and core modules, excluding tests and types. | | src/client/__tests__/broker-provider.test.ts | Comprehensive unit tests covering all broker auth error paths and success scenarios with mocked fetch. | | src/__tests__/e2e/broker-auth.test.ts | E2E tests with real HTTP server validating full broker auth flow including authentication failures. | | package.json | Added `TWITTER_BROKER_API_KEY` parameter, updated broker mode description, and added `mock:broker` script. | | README.md | Reorganized auth setup to prioritize broker mode, added comprehensive broker setup instructions and examples. |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Agent as Eliza Agent participant Plugin as Twitter Plugin participant Broker as Token Broker participant Twitter as Twitter API v2 Note over Agent,Twitter: Broker Auth Mode Flow Agent->>Plugin: Initialize with broker mode Plugin->>Plugin: Validate broker URL and API key Agent->>Plugin: Post tweet or API action Plugin->>Plugin: getAccessToken() via BrokerAuthProvider Plugin->>Broker: GET /v1/twitter/access-token
Authorization: Bearer [agent key] alt Valid API Key Broker->>Broker: Validate agent credentials Broker->>Broker: Generate/fetch OAuth2 token Broker-->>Plugin: 200 OK
{access_token, expires_at} Plugin->>Plugin: Validate response fields Plugin->>Twitter: Twitter API call
Authorization: Bearer [token] Twitter-->>Plugin: Success Plugin-->>Agent: Success else Invalid API Key Broker-->>Plugin: 401/403 Unauthorized Plugin->>Plugin: Throw error with hint Plugin-->>Agent: Error: Check broker API key else Network/Server Error Broker-->>Plugin: 500/timeout Plugin->>Plugin: Throw error with details Plugin-->>Agent: Error: Failed to reach broker end ``` (3/5) Reply to the agent's comments like "Can you suggest a fix for this @greptileai?" or ask follow-up questions!
